instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V
threads.message:
Clean board with no liquid damage at all.

<SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4V

Diode Mode

------- <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> Powerline
<CAPACITOR>C3200</CAPACITOR> = 0.376
<CAPACITOR>C3201</CAPACITOR> = 0.147
<CAPACITOR>C3204</CAPACITOR> = 0.527
<CAPACITOR>C3205</CAPACITOR> = 0.497
<CAPACITOR>C3206</CAPACITOR> = 0.536
<CAPACITOR>C3208</CAPACITOR> = 0.526
------- <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> PowerLine
<CAPACITOR>C3100</CAPACITOR> = 0.376
<CAPACITOR>C3101</CAPACITOR> = 0.156
<CAPACITOR>C3104</CAPACITOR> = 0.527
<CAPACITOR>C3105</CAPACITOR> = 0.498
<CAPACITOR>C3106</CAPACITOR> = 0.534
<CAPACITOR>C3108</CAPACITOR> = 0.518

------- UB300 PowerLine
CB300 = 0.376
CB301 = 0.157
CB304 = 0.527
CB305 = 0.439
CB306 = 0.536
CB308 = 0.493

------- CB400 Power Line
CB400 = 0.376
CB401 = 0.156
CB404 = 0.527
CB405 = 0.498
CB406 = 0.536
CB408 = 0.521

What else should i check?

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V
threads.message:
Change UB300 first.

Check if you get 1V1 LDO on each chip.
